full_text: Page 3753 MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-G DATE: 08/10/2019 TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE 12:00-12:30 AM 8:00-8:30 AM 4:00-4:30 PM 12:30- 1:00 AM 8:30- 9:00 AM 4:30-5:00 PM 1:00-1:30 AM 9:00-9:30 AM 5:00 -5:30 PM 1:30-2:00 AM 9:30-10:00 AM 5:30-6:00 PM 2:00-2:30 AM 10:00-10:30 AM 6:00-6:30 PM 2:30-3:00 AM 10:30-11:00 AM 6:30-7:00 PM 3:00-3:30 AM 11:00-11:30 AM 7:00-7:30 PM 3:30-4:00 AM 11:30-12:00 AM 7:30-8:00 PM 4:00-4:30 AM 12:00-12:30 PM 8:00-8:30 PM 4:30-5:00 AM 12:30- 1:00 PM 8:30- 9:00 PM 5:00 -5:30 AM 1:00-1:30 PM 9:00-9:30 PM 5:30-6:00 AM 1:30-2:00 PM 9:30-10:00 PM 6:00-6:30 AM 2:00-2:30 PM 10:00-10:30 PM 6:30-7:00 AM 2:30-3:00 PM 10:30-11:00 PM 7:00-7:30 AM 3:00-3:30 PM 11:00-11:30 PM 7:30-8:00 AM 3:30-4:00 PM 11:30-12:00 PM MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented. REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN DOJ-OGR-00027068

text_blocks.content: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT 30 MINUTE CHECK SHEET ZA TIER-G
TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE TIME FRAME TIME START TIME END SIGNATURE
MORNING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT DAY WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT EVENING WATCH OPERATIONS LIEUTENANT

A staff member must observe all inmates confined in a continuous locked down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, at least once in the first 30 minute period of the hour (example, 12:00 a.m. - 12:30 a.m.) followed by another round in the second 30 minutes period of the same hour (example, 12:30 am - 1:00 a.m.), thus ensuring an inmate is observed at least twice per hour. These rounds are to be conducted on an irregular schedule and no more than 40 minutes apart. All observations must be documented.
REVIEWED BY MORNING WATCH LIEUTENANT CAPTAIN

additional_notes: The document appears to be a scanned copy of a 30-minute check sheet used in a correctional facility. The sheet is filled with handwritten times and some redactions. The document is generally legible, but some handwritten numbers are difficult to read.
